original_title: Sri Lanka citizens given extra duty free baggage on inward remittances
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has issued regulation allowing extra duty free baggage allowance to returnees who had remitted foreign exchange through the banking system.
The allowances would apply to citizens and dual citizens once a year.
A ‘Silver’ category who had remitted at least 2,400 dollars would get an extra 600 dollars.
A ‘Sliver Plus’ category that had remitted over 4,800 dollars would get an extra 980 dollars.
A ‘Gold’ category that had remitted over 7,200 dollars would get an extra 1,440 dollars.
A ‘Gold Plus’ category that had remitted over 12,000 dollars would get an extra 2,400 dollars.
A ‘Platinum’ category that had remitted over 24,000 dollars would get an extra 4,800 dollars.

The standard allowance 187.5 dollars for a person who had been out of the country for less than 90 days, 625 dollars for less than a year and 1,750 dollars for a person who had been out for more than a year. (Colombo/May08/2023)
